intro: Armeria vasconica, commonly known as the Vasconian thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees and northern Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has linear, grass-like leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Armeria vasconica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature.
